metadata.title: CVE-2012-4294 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Buffer overflow in the channelised_fill_sdh_g707_format function inepan/dissectors/packet-erf.c in the ERF dissector in Wireshark 1.8.x before1.8.2 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a large speed(aka rate) value.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-4294` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
libwireshark5 - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
libwiretap4 - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
libwsutil4 - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
tshark - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
wireshark - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
wireshark-common - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
wireshark-qt - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wireshark package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.12.1+g01b65bf-2').
